parsers
Class XMLPutter

java.lang.Object
  parsers.XMLPutter

public class XMLPutter
extends java.lang.Object

Creates a Putter that puts the XML information to the server.

This class uses the Singleton Pattern, thus, only one instance of it is allowed All the information that we need on the server get from here.

Author:
Zhong Ren

makeTicket

public java.lang.String makeTicket(Flight flight,
                                   boolean isFirstClass)
Makes an XML representation of a ticket that is used to purchase a flight from the database.

Parameters:
flight - the flight that will be purchased
isFirstClass - true if you want the 1st Class ticket for that flight. False if you want the Coach class.
Returns:
the XML String representation of the ticket.

buyTicket

public int buyTicket(java.lang.String ticket)
Purchases a ticket from the flight database.

Parameters:
ticket - the ticket for the flight that will be purchased.
Returns:
a map of the response. "Successful, Response Code".

If the ticket was successfully bought, then you will get "true, 200".

Else you will get "false, response code".
